intro: Cavanilla acutangula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cavanilla, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and are arranged in clusters. Cavanilla acutangula is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
